title: West Tisbury students launch campaign to eliminate plastic straws
body: During the 2014-15 school year, sixth and seventh graders at the West Tisbury School were disturbed to learn that the United States uses enough plastic straws to wrap around the Earth's ...
readable_content: - The Martha's Vineyard Times (2023-12-10): During the 2014-15 school year, sixth and seventh graders at the West Tisbury School initiated the campaign Straw Free MV to reduce plastic pollution. Their goal was to eliminate the use of plastic straws through education, beach cleanups, and collaboration with restaurants. The students ordered eco-friendly paper straws and visited various restaurants to urge them to stop or reduce the use of plastic straws. The initiative garnered positive responses from businesses and empowered the students to make a difference. They also learned about the consequences of their actions and the impact of seemingly small things like straws on the environment.
summary:
The passage shows the positive impact of the Straw Free MV campaign initiated by sixth and seventh graders to reduce plastic pollution through education and collaboration with businesses. It highlights their success in empowering the students to make a difference and educating them about environmental consequences. Overall, the sentiment is positive.
